name: Avoid using querySelectorAll
description: This rule will check the use of querySelectorAll
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
Ensure your web application interactivity by accessing/manipulating the DOM tree with high performance queries/enumerators.
Compared to getElementsByTagName and getElementsByClassName, querySelectorAll can be 40 time slower.
remediation: Instead of using querySelectorAll, you will use getElementsByTagName() or getElementsByClassName().
alternativeName: Avoid using querySelectorAll, prefer getElementsByTagName() or getElementsByClassName() to have better performance.
